content.description:
This route starts about 6 feet to the right of ‘Easy Day for An Old Lady’. 

Pitch 1: Climb straight up 25 feet to a small ledge and then right toward a bulging overhang. Pull the overhang and follow the corner system up to where the wall color starts to the change (the “Black Wall” feature). Belay here. 

Pitch 2: Climb up and left to a roof. Pull the roof heading int oa small dihedral. Pass a couple of small overhangs on the left side then continue climbing up toward the left side of a large overhang. Climb through to the top.

This is one of my favorite routes at the Gap! 

Pitch 1: Use the same first pitch of ‘Easy Day for An Old Lady’. 

Pitch 2: Exit the belay station and head to the left side of the overhang above. After the overhang go right toward the large slanted block (optional belay). From the top right side of the block climb onto the overhanging wall and continue climbing past the horizontal cracks to the top.
content.protection: FULL set of nuts, hexes, small to medium cams and a #3 Camalot

content.description:
Pitch 1: Climb up toward a prow following a corner system without using the left wall.

 Pitch 2: Continue up toward a roof pulling past to the top.
content.protection: Standard gap rack: Small to medium cams, 1 large cam, set of stoppers, small tri-cams.

climbs.name: Easy Day for an Old Lady

content.description:
This route starts 30 feet to the right (further uphill) from ‘Dunce’s Corner’. 

Pitch 1: Climb up and to the left into a dihedral with an overhang on top. Work your way up the dihedral to the overhang and then climb left. Work your way back right past a steep rock section for about 18 feet to a belay. 

Pitch 2: Follow the groove above the belay up left to the overhang. Traverse to the right around the overhang to an arete. Climb this to the top. An optional belay could be used here to avoid rope drag on the last section of the climb making it a 3-pitch route.
content.location: On route with 'Ride of the Valkyries'

content.description:
This route starts 20 feet to the right of ‘Black Wall & Valhalla”. 

Pitch 1: Climb the groove below the prow for 20 feet or so to a bulging overhang. Climb the left side up to the small belay ledge of ‘Valhalla’. 

Pitch 2: From the belay, exit up and to the right toward the cave/inset. Continue up and to the left on a steep section of rock to the large overhanging roof above. Follow the black wall feature around the roof and up to the top. This section is runout but fun.

Pitch 1: This route uses the same first pitch as ‘Valhalla’. 

Pitch 2: Out of the belay follow the slanting corner on the left side of the discolored “Black Wall”. Climb through the overhanging section to another overhanging roof. Belay here.

Pitch 3: Climb around the roof on its right side past a small crack to the top.

Variations: Variation 1: Shades of Death 5.8 PG/R Variation 2: Death Ledges 5.7 PG/R Variation 3: Valhalla 5.10d PG/R Variation 4: Heart of Darkness 5.10a PG/R
content.protection: 2 sets of nuts, small to large cams up to 3". hexes, lots of 2' slings
content.location: Start at a shallow groove 20' right of the right end or the Cheatstone block.

content.description: This wall has some of the best routes on the New Jersey side of the Delaware Water Gap. The large wall to the upper right of the'Cheatstone Boulder'.
